function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Use of chemical-based vector control tools may lead to environmental contamination and harm non-target species.","Impact":"Environmental contamination and harm to non-target species can result in ecosystem disruption and loss of biodiversity.","Mitigation":"Use integrated vector management strategies that involve a combination of methods to reduce reliance on chemical-based tools, conduct environmental impact assessments, and implement targeted application techniques.","Technologies":"Biological larvicides, habitat modification, and integrated vector management strategies.","People":"Non-target species, ecosystems, and biodiversity.","Owner":"Environmental agencies, vector control authorities, and research institutions."},{"Description":"Limited use of vaccines for diseases like dengue due to safety concerns may hinder effective disease control and prevention.","Impact":"Limited vaccine use can result in continued high disease burden, outbreaks, and increased healthcare costs.","Mitigation":"Conduct further research to address safety concerns, increase public awareness and education about vaccine safety, and implement targeted vaccination campaigns in high-risk areas.","Technologies":"Improved vaccine technology and development, public health education campaigns, and targeted vaccination strategies.","People":"Populations at risk of dengue and other vector-borne diseases.","Owner":"Public health authorities, vaccine manufacturers, and research institutions."},{"Description":"Genetic manipulation of mosquitoes and other novel vector control tools may have unintended consequences on ecosystems and biodiversity.","Impact":"Unintended consequences can lead to ecological imbalances, disruption of food chains, and loss of natural predators of disease vectors.","Mitigation":"Conduct comprehensive risk assessments and field trials, implement strict regulatory guidelines, and monitor long-term ecological impacts.","Technologies":"Risk assessment protocols, environmental monitoring technologies, and regulatory frameworks.","People":"Ecosystems, biodiversity, and local communities in areas where novel vector control tools are implemented.","Owner":"Regulatory authorities, environmental agencies, and research institutions."}]}
